unorm 0.1.0
  • Reference

Standard 1D NMR Preprocessing

preprocessing.Rd

Standard 1D NMR Preprocessing

preprocessing(
  X,
  ppm,
  meta,
  flip = TRUE,
  cali = TRUE,
  calibrant = "tsp",
  linWid = 1,
  baseline = TRUE,
  lowerCutoff,
  upperCutoff,
  waterLower,
  waterUpper,
  ureaLower,
  ureaUpper
)

Arguments

X

A matrix containing the NMR spectral data, the rows containing all values of a single experiment and the columns contain values per chemical shift variables.
ppm

An array of the chemical shift variables the same length as X.
meta

The matrix of metadata pertaining to the X matrix. This is crucial for the TSP calibration and linewidth calculation.
flip

A function that checks the orientation of spectra. This is a particularly important function for spectra derived from a small number of scans; the NMR orientates spectra based on what side of the y-axis has the most signal and water has a very large impact on this and without a large amount of metabolite signal on the correct side of the spectra (as seen in spectra derived from small scans) the spectra will be orientated the wrong way.
cali

This is a metabom8 function that calibrates the spectra based on the TSP signal. Calibration is standardly performed by the NMR but this can be performed again for certainty.
calibrant

This is the signal you wish to use as the calibrant. This signal must be compatible with the metabom8 function. For urine spectra, tsp is the main calibrant.
linWid

The maximum line width of peaks that should be filtered for. 1.0 is default and standard in NMR spectra.
baseline

This function calls on the metabom8 function *bline* to flatten and correct the baseline; baseline correction.
lowerCutoff

The ppm value from where the lowest limit of the spectra will be trimmed/cutoff at.
upperCutoff

The ppm value from where the highest limit of the spectra will be trimmed/cutoff at.
waterLower

The lower ppm value from which the water region will be cut from.
waterUpper

The upper ppm value from which the water region will be cut to.
ureaLower

The lower ppm value from which the urea region will be cut from.
ureaUpper

The upper ppm value from which the urea region will be cut to.

Details

This function streamlines the preprocessing process combining a range of functions that ensure the spectra are orientated the correct way, will calibrate the spectra based on a specific peak, calculate the line width of the peaks and return warnings if they exceed a specified threshold, remove the lower, upper, water and urea region of the spectra, correct the baseline using asymmetric least squares and will verify that the resulting X, ppm and meta objects match appropriately.
